text: after days under the rebel Rishi Canal
has been pulled out alive from a
collapsed apartment block here in the
capital the doctors have to work fast to
save him
his condition is really critical it
seems his both legs are broken and his
forties are also commercial might be in
so he has been under the buildings
I think horrible in to Annapolis he'd
apparently survived without food and
with only a little water some hope
yesterday I've given up my nails went
white and my lips cracked I'd lost all
hope since yesterday and I was sure no
one was coming for me I was certain I
was going to die the relief effort is
gaining momentum here in the capital as
more and more emergency teams arrive
from around the world but it's also
becoming increasingly apparent that the
need is enormous and the weather is not
helping there's been heavy rain making
conditions even more difficult for the
thousands who've lost their homes and
are now camping outside so far today the
weather is a lot better but the forecast
is for more thunderstorms over much of
the next seven days but out in the
villages and towns to the west of
Kathmandu near the earthquake epicenter
the situation is even more serious only
a few areas have received any help aid
workers have only just managed to reach
this remote village where many people
are now homeless and are desperate for
assistance Richard Galpin BBC news
